title: Grand Uzbekistan Tour - 9 Days
description: Complete journey through Uzbekistan's ancient Silk Road cities: Tashkent, Samarkand, Bukhara, and Khiva. Experience the best of Central Asian culture, architecture, and hospitality.
highlights: Tashkent – Modern capital with Soviet-era architecture and vibrant bazaars
Samarkand – Iconic Registan Square, Shah-i-Zinda, and Gur-e-Amir Mausoleum
Bukhara – Ancient Silk Road city with 140+ architectural monuments
Khiva – Open-air museum city with perfectly preserved old town (Itchan Kala)
freeCancellation: Free cancellation up to 7 days before departure
healthSafety: All safety measures followed. Travel insurance recommended.

faq.question: What is the best time to visit Uzbekistan?
faq.answer: Spring (April-June) and autumn (September-November) offer the most pleasant weather. Summer can be very hot (40°C+) while winter is cold but atmospheric.

faq.question: Do I need a visa for Uzbekistan?
faq.answer: Many nationalities can enter visa-free for up to 30 days. Check your country's requirements before booking.

faq.question: What currency is used in Uzbekistan?
faq.answer: Uzbek Som (UZS). USD and EUR are widely accepted. ATMs available in major cities.

itinerary.title: Arrival in Tashkent
itinerary.description: Welcome to Uzbekistan! Meet your guide at Tashkent International Airport and transfer to your hotel. Free time to rest and acclimatize. Optional evening walk around Amir Timur Square.

itinerary.title: Tashkent City Tour
itinerary.description: Explore the capital's highlights: Khast Imam Complex (home to the world's oldest Quran), Chorsu Bazaar, Tashkent Metro stations (underground palaces), and Independence Square. Experience blend of Soviet and Islamic architecture.

itinerary.title: Tashkent to Samarkand (High-Speed Train)
itinerary.description: Morning transfer to railway station for comfortable high-speed train journey to Samarkand (2 hours). Afternoon visit to Registan Square, the heart of ancient Samarkand with three magnificent madrasahs. Evening stroll and optional light show.

itinerary.title: Samarkand Full Day Tour
itinerary.description: Full day exploring Samarkand's treasures: Gur-e-Amir Mausoleum (Timur's tomb), Shah-i-Zinda necropolis with stunning blue tilework, Ulugbek Observatory, and Bibi-Khanym Mosque. Visit Siab Bazaar for local crafts and spices.

itinerary.title: Samarkand to Bukhara
itinerary.description: Morning drive to Bukhara (280km, 4 hours) through scenic landscapes. En route visit pottery workshop in Gijduvan. Afternoon arrival in Bukhara, check-in and rest. Evening walk around Lyabi-Hauz complex.

itinerary.title: Bukhara Old City Tour
itinerary.description: Explore Bukhara's architectural wonders: Ark Fortress, Po-i-Kalyan Complex with iconic Kalyan Minaret, Mir-i-Arab Madrasah, and the historic trading domes. Visit Magoki-Attori Mosque and enjoy a traditional folk show in the evening.

itinerary.title: Bukhara to Khiva
itinerary.description: Early morning departure for long but scenic drive across Kyzylkum Desert to Khiva (450km, 7 hours). Lunch stop in desert oasis. Arrive evening in Khiva, check-in to hotel. Rest and prepare for next day's exploration.

itinerary.title: Khiva - Itchan Kala Full Day
itinerary.description: Full day exploring UNESCO-listed Itchan Kala, the walled inner town of Khiva. Visit Kalta Minor Minaret, Kunya Ark Citadel, Juma Mosque with 212 wooden columns, Islam Khodja Minaret, and Tash Khovli Palace. Climb minaret for sunset views.

itinerary.title: Khiva to Tashkent - Departure
itinerary.description: Morning flight from Urgench to Tashkent. Depending on your international flight time, optional last-minute shopping or visit to Tashkent's modern areas. Transfer to airport for your departure flight home with unforgettable memories.

included: All transfers with private air-conditioned vehicle
All entrance fees to monuments and museums
